description.en: In-depth critical discussion of methodological problems in the fields of ethnology and folklore.
description.et: Seminarides toimub etnoloogia ja rahvaluule erialade metodoloogiliste probleemide kriitiline arutelu.

objectives.en: To discuss theoretical problems and the completed chapters of doctoral theses.
objectives.et: Arutada teoreetilisi uurimisprobleeme ja doktoritööde valminud osi.

learning_outcomes.en: Students will be able to discuss theoretical problems of ethnology and folklore studies in-depth, to apply disciplinary theoretical and methodological approaches in their research and to assess critically theoretical and methodological issues of ethnology and folklore studies.
learning_outcomes.et: Aine läbimisel suudab üliõpilane arutada etnoloogia ja folkloristika teoreetilistel teemadel kõrgtasemel, on võimeline rakendama erialaseid teoreetilisi ja metodoloogilisi lähenemisviise oma uurimustes ning oskab neid kriitiliselt hinnata.

independent_work.et:
Kodulugemine ja miniettekanded oma uurimisteema ja materjali põhjal.

description.et:
Teoreetiliste lugemismaterjalide tundmine. Aktiivne osalemine seminarides. Teadmiste rakendamine oma uurimisküsmiustele ja materjalidele.

Ettevalmistus: Enne seminari täitke etteantud lugemised ja ülesanded.

Attendance: Arrive on time and stay for the full session.
Respect: Listen actively and respect diverse perspectives.
Engagement: Stay focused and avoid distractions (e.g., phones).
Preparation: Complete assigned pre-readings and tasks before the seminar.
Follow-Up: Submit any post-seminar assignments or reflections on time.

description.et:
Pre-Seminar Preparation: Students must read assigned materials on research ethics and data protection laws. 

Active Participation: Engage in discussions about ethical dilemmas and propose solutions for hypothetical cases. 

Team Activity: Collaborate to design a mock data collection plan and identify potential ethical issues. 

Questions and Reflection: Come prepared with at least one question or insight related to the topic.

Bring a Dataset: Students should bring an example dataset (real or simulated) to discuss potential quality issues. 

Workshop Contribution: Participate in small group activities to assess and clean data. 

Documentation Practice: Demonstrate how to document changes made during data preparation. 

Respect Peer Work: Provide constructive feedback during group evaluations.

Specialized data collection seminar at the University library (W. Struve 1, Tartu) will be 27th of March 10-12 am. The seminar will take place in room "Kodavere", which is room nr 186.
The seminar will be held by the Information Specialist and Junior Research Fellow Eda-Riin Tuuling.

Pre-Seminar Review: Review the differences between the three analysis methods. 

Practical Application: Practice coding a sample text using the discussed methods. 

Peer Review: Share and critique coding strategies with a partner. 

Participatory Learning: Contribute actively to discussions about the strengths and limitations of each method.

Preparation: Bring a coded excerpt or data sample for narrative analysis. 

Collaborative Activity: Work in pairs to identify themes and refine codes. 

Creativity and Clarity: Present a short narrative based on analyzed data. 

Group Feedback: Engage respectfully in giving and receiving feedback.

Honest Self-Assessment: Reflect on potential biases in your own research. 

Case Study Discussion: Analyze examples of biased research and suggest improvements. 

Transparency Exercise: Draft a plan for presenting research phases with full transparency. 

Engagement: Actively ask questions and participate in bias mitigation strategies.

Article Draft: Bring a draft (or outline) of an article for discussion. 

Collaborative Peer Review: Engage in a structured peer review session, providing detailed and constructive feedback. 

Pitch Presentation: Practice presenting your research to a journal editor in a mock scenario. 

Ethical Responsibility: Acknowledge the importance of ethical authorship practices during discussions.
